page.title: 18FORD PARISH CHURCH
page.content: FORD PARISH CHURCH Known as the church of St.Michael's and All Angels,it is an ancient structure dating from the 13th century.The building is now in a sound condition,for this year has seen the replacement of the existing tile roof over the nave by a slate one.The work was carried out by a local builder at a cost of about Â£20,000. The present incumbent is a non-stipendiary priest,being the only one in the Norham Deanery and this year he is to have the help of a non-stipendiary deacon. The congregation averages 25 and the main money raising function is a fete held in the grounds of the adjacent castle.This raises about Â£1,000 and together with covenants and free-will offerings meets the costs of the churches upkeep.
